item.title: “Bayes Rule”
item.description: Bayes’ Rule is a theorem in probability theory that states that the probability of an event, given some prior knowledge, can be calculated by multiplying the prior probability of the event by the probability of the event given the prior knowledge.

item.title: “Bayes Theorem”
item.description: What is Bayes Theorem? Bayes Theorem is a way to figure out how likely something is to be true. It helps you make an educated guess about something that might be true, even if you don’t know for sure.
